Class Register

java.lang.Object
Register
public class Register
extends java.lang.Object
Class Register: Holds the main fucntionality of the register object for the assignment, Contains the number of each type of bill and coin in the register and allows the user to make change based on user purchases
Version:
2/5/2021
Author:
Peter Mertka

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private int numDimes
    integer: the number of dimes in the register
    private int numFives
    integer: the number of five dollar bills in the register

    integer: the number of nickels in the register
    private int numOnes

    (package private) java.util.Random random1
    Random: This random object allows for a random number of bills to be generated in the register each time an object is made

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Register()
    Class constructor Creates a new register object, with each bill and coin being initilized to a random number between 0 and 15

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    (package private) void addMoneyToRegister​(int twenties, int tens, int fives, int ones, int quarters, int dimes, int nickels, int pennies)
    adds the bills used by the customer to pay to the register so that they can be used for change if necessary
    (package private) void beginOperation()
    Main loop that handles purchases, runs to handle multiple purchases per the user input
    (package private) int changeToCents​(double value)
    Converts the price of the item from a double dollar value to an integer value of cents
    (package private) int checkCashInRegister()
    Calculates the total amount of money in the register and prints out how many of each bill and coin you have
    (package private) int getValidInput()
    Method to get a valid, positive, integer user input
    (package private) void handleSale​(int twenties, int tens, int fives, int ones, int quarters, int dimes, int nickels, int pennies, double priceOfItem)
    Function that handles purchases by taking in bills and calculating whether a sale can take place
    (package private) void removeMoneyFromRegister​(int twenties, int tens, int fives, int ones, int quarters, int dimes, int nickels, int pennies)
    Takes the bills out of the register if the cashier is unable to make proper change, returning the bills to the customer
    (package private) void returnChange​(int amountOwed, int twenties, int tens, int fives, int ones, int quarters, int dimes, int nickels, int pennies)
    Calculates the correct change needed based on the transaction, trying to find the most efficient change possible Returns the money to the customer and throws an error if not enough bills to provide change
    (package private) int sumBillsAndCoins​(int twenties, int tens, int fives, int ones, int quarters, int dimes, int nickels, int pennies)
    Sums up the bills and coins used by the customer and convers the number to cents

    • checkCashInRegister

      int checkCashInRegister()

      integer: cash value of all money in register in cents

    • returnChange

      void returnChange​(int amountOwed, int twenties, int tens, int fives, int ones, int quarters, int dimes, int nickels, int pennies)
      Calculates the correct change needed based on the transaction, trying to find the most efficient change possible Returns the money to the customer and throws an error if not enough bills to provide change
      Parameters:
      amountOwed - integer: amount of total change owed in cents
      twenties - integer: number of twenty dollar bills used by customer to pay
      tens - integer: number of ten dollar bills used by customer to pay
      fives - integer: number of five dollar bills used by customer to pay
      ones - integer: number of one dollar bills used by customer to pay
      quarters - integer: number of quarters used by customer to pay
      dimes - integer: number of dimes used by customer to pay
      nickels - integer: number of nickels used by customer to pay
      pennies - integer: number of pennies used by customer to pay
